commit.message:
November 2023 updated builds 2 (#152)

Update build versions.  Add documentation.

Github Actions and Appveyor . . .

From announcement
9th November 2023: PostgreSQL 16.1, 15.5, 14.10, 13.13, 12.17, and 11.22 Released!
11.22 with R-4.1.3 continues to be an x86 build.

R-4.3.2 for Windows
https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/

Github Actions specifically . . .

Note, Github Actions, is still providing postgresql-x64-14.
https://github.com/actions/runner-images/blob/main/images/windows/Windows2022-Readme.md

MSYS2 PostgreSQL repository version changed from 15.5 to 16.1
https://packages.msys2.org/package/mingw-w64-ucrt-x86_64-postgresql

Added comments(documention) on the subject:
`A HUMAN must manually see the VERSION here.`

Appveyor specifically . . .

Updated the comments of R-4.2.3 with Microsoft Visual C++

commit.message:
Update versions of PG and R. Introduce the meson build system. (#146)

```
appveyor.yml - In the matrix, remove the last rversion: 4.1.3 that can
               compile on x86 except keep with the last x86 PG
               version 10 for windows.

appveyor.yml - add msvc Win32(x86), add msys2 x86, add cygwin x86

appveyor.yml - When using Micrsoft Visual Studio 2017 and older,
               in the  duplicate 'plr' entry is required.
               This demonstrated and tested in the appveyor.yml matrix.

.github\workflows\build.yml - In syntax only, remove the redundant
                              version combinations. No change.

                            - Github Actions run-name

.github\workflows\schedule.yml - Github Actions run-name

install.md and userguide.md - Update the documentation to reflect
                              PostgreSQL version 16 and the
                              latest R version 4.3.1.

.github\workflows\*meson*

    - meson builds: Windows using MSYS2(UCRT64)
      and PostgreSQL 16, 15, 14, 10(x86); cygwin x64.
    - MSYS2(UCRT64) build can be configured to do two(2) regression
      tests.
    -   1. PostgreSQL for MSYS2.
    -   2. PostgreSQL for Windows (from EnterpriseDB).
    - meson.build type 1:
        PG16+ only - in-source-contrib - contrib/plr/build.meson.
        PL/R is compiled with the rest of PostgreSQL 16+.
        This build leverages the meson build system introducted in
        PostgreSQL 16.
        The user needs to guarantee/set the Rlib, PATH and R_HOME.
    - meson.build type 2: Old x86 PG version 10 and recent x64 PG
        versions from master and 16
        and tested back through PG13 - in-binary-contribplr.
        PL/R  binds to an already pre-compiled PostreSQL.
        This build is/can_be independent of any
        "meson build system introducted in PostgreSQL 16."
        The user needs to guarantee/set the
        Rlib,libpq,libpostgres, PATH and R_HOME.
    - some starter Microsoft Visual Studio support.
      Currently, only installs msvc pre-required software.

Note, of the file .github\workflows\buildPLR.yml, to send
the 'pushed tag'assets  to the Github repository release location,
one needs to setup . . .

the https://github.com/ncipollo/release-action
token: ${{ secrets.ACTIONS_CREATE_RELEASE_REPO_SECRET }}

This secret ACTIONS_CREATE_RELEASE_REPO_SECRET
has the same content (and the secret starts with the letters ghp_) as
https://github.com/settings/tokens tokens(classic)

The selected scopes are "repo" and all of its sub-scopes.
```

verification.payload:
tree e72b053d8d889d96ee7cac866f50e259bfe2b479
parent 20a1f133bcf2bc8f37ac23da191aea590d612619
author AndreMikulec <Andre_Mikulec@Hotmail.com> 1694802391 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1694802391 -0400

        The user needs to guarantee/set the Rlib, PATH and R_HOME.
    - meson.build type 2: Old x86 PG version 10 and recent x64 PG

        and tested back through PG13 - in-binary-contribplr.
        PL/R  binds to an already pre-compiled PostreSQL.
        This build is/can_be independent of any
        "meson build system introducted in PostgreSQL 16."
        The user needs to guarantee/set the
        Rlib,libpq,libpostgres, PATH and R_HOME.
    - some starter Microsoft Visual Studio support.
      Currently, only installs msvc pre-required software.

Note, of the file .github\workflows\buildPLR.yml, to send
the 'pushed tag'assets  to the Github repository release location,

commit.message:
Build plr with Microsoft Visual Studio 2022 (#142)

* Updated the software versions.

* Appveyor default ActiveState Perl is not working.
  Changed to Strawberry Perl to prevent 'FAKE' from being written into the pgsql.sln file

* Removed the semi-duplicate extra 'plr' entry in the pgsql.sln file.
  Non-duplicate entries are required to compile
  with Microsoft Visual Studio versions 2019 and later

verification.payload:
tree f6febf2bd7c23bef330c9977663dfbb81a1f9ed0
parent 4ac054e61c62f72a9cd3a38f66476d037b3e27a5
author AndreMikulec <Andre_Mikulec@Hotmail.com> 1686998018 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1686998018 -0400

Build plr with Microsoft Visual Studio 2022 (#142)

* Updated the software versions.

* Appveyor default ActiveState Perl is not working.
  Changed to Strawberry Perl to prevent 'FAKE' from being written into the pgsql.sln file

* Removed the semi-duplicate extra 'plr' entry in the pgsql.sln file.
  Non-duplicate entries are required to compile
  with Microsoft Visual Studio versions 2019 and later

commit.message:
Issue 127 Fix the pgcrypto position error in the Windows build that uses pg master (#128)

The error is here.

https://ci.appveyor.com/project/davecramer/plr-lek5y/builds/41423726/job/tlaw5ghh8sgqun86?fullLog=true#L91

Everything about pgcrypto was removed in this commit affecting the file src/tools/msvc/Mkvcbuild.pm
postgres/postgres@db7d1a7#diff-fd3a59b81739e0c9f354d679334926ecfc23defb2b3d477f9d22f182adb19afe

To fix this error, in the file src/tools/msvc/Mkvcbuild.pm, detect if the pgcrypto code does not exist,
then, if true, insert the Perl code that creates the MSVC plr project to the positon that is before(above) the line

```
foreach my $subdir ('contrib', 'src/test/modules')
```
instead of to position that is after(below) pgcrypto.

Fixes Issue https://github.com/postgres-plr/plr/issues/127

verification.payload:
tree 00e0a978f1a6c4fbdc1a83f3bb8685d99d1fb712
parent 641189cf042c5180be29031f762e5a99123b0c67
author AndreMikulec <Andre_Mikulec@Hotmail.com> 1640266287 -0600
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1640266287 -0500

Issue 127 Fix the pgcrypto position error in the Windows build that uses pg master (#128)

The error is here.

https://ci.appveyor.com/project/davecramer/plr-lek5y/builds/41423726/job/tlaw5ghh8sgqun86?fullLog=true#L91

Everything about pgcrypto was removed in this commit affecting the file src/tools/msvc/Mkvcbuild.pm
postgres/postgres@db7d1a7#diff-fd3a59b81739e0c9f354d679334926ecfc23defb2b3d477f9d22f182adb19afe

To fix this error, in the file src/tools/msvc/Mkvcbuild.pm, detect if the pgcrypto code does not exist,
then, if true, insert the Perl code that creates the MSVC plr project to the positon that is before(above) the line

```
foreach my $subdir ('contrib', 'src/test/modules')
```
instead of to position that is after(below) pgcrypto.

Fixes Issue https://github.com/postgres-plr/plr/issues/127

commit.message:
Add support for pg custom type (tuple) arguments in window PL/R functions (#56)

* Tuple arguments support in PL/R Window Functions

* Allow to take RECORD as input argument type

* Change var names for clarity: nr to num_partition_rows and numels to num_frame_row

* fix regtest for opt_window_frame

* Remove last (empty) row of expected/opt_window_frame.out

* Add opt_window_frame to REGRESS var in Makefile

Co-authored-by: Mikhail Titov <mlt@gmx.us>

author ikasou <ilias.kasoumis@gmail.com> 1622117243 +0300
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1622117243 -0400

commit.message:
Issue Fix #89 Appveyor: patching of Mkvcbuild.pm and vcregress.pl, should happen automatically (#110)

Currently, the msvc.diff file works on PostgreSQL 13 and master.

One is limited, in such a way, that one can not use msvc and the msvc.diff to
compile from source, PostgreSQL 12 (that is currently, still supported).
So, if someone should ask for a msvc "plr that is compiled from PostgreSQL 12 source",
one can not build that plr.

msvc.diff is used to modify the file Mkvcbuild.pm and vcregress.pl.
This file, Mkvcbuild.pm, is under heavy maintenance, and is modified using
the frequency, of once or twice per month.

https://github.com/postgres/postgres/commits/master/src/tools/msvc/Mkvcbuild.pm

In the master branch, in Mkvcbuild.pm (or vcregress.pl),
the situation is that every time someone (1) vertically shifts a line
or (2) or modifies of the Perl array @contrib_excludes,
one has to create a new msvc.diff file.

This fix enhances:

  1. avoids the manual re-creation of the msvc.diff file
     that would occur in Mkvcbuild.pm (and vcregress.pl) after
     (1) a vertical line shift or
     (2) addition or modification of the Perl array @contrib_excludes.
     by
     including a file msvc.diff.R that is a program that
     modifies the Mkvcbuild.pm and vcregress.pl.

  2. adds the ability to compile plr using PostgreSQL
     git branches, git tags, or git commit hashes

  3. adds demo compilations plr using PostgreSQL
     versions(git tags): REL_13_0 and REL_12_0

Issue Fix https://github.com/postgres-plr/plr/issues/89

verification.payload:
tree f69fa37506fafd649a6627373304b45d1d60dbba
parent ed71a0e18ff1620448219e298e52691ceb83c7c0
author AndreMikulec <Andre_Mikulec@Hotmail.com> 1621947950 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1621947950 -0400

Issue Fix #89 Appveyor: patching of Mkvcbuild.pm and vcregress.pl, should happen automatically (#110)

Currently, the msvc.diff file works on PostgreSQL 13 and master.

One is limited, in such a way, that one can not use msvc and the msvc.diff to
compile from source, PostgreSQL 12 (that is currently, still supported).
So, if someone should ask for a msvc "plr that is compiled from PostgreSQL 12 source",
one can not build that plr.

msvc.diff is used to modify the file Mkvcbuild.pm and vcregress.pl.
This file, Mkvcbuild.pm, is under heavy maintenance, and is modified using
the frequency, of once or twice per month.

https://github.com/postgres/postgres/commits/master/src/tools/msvc/Mkvcbuild.pm

In the master branch, in Mkvcbuild.pm (or vcregress.pl),
the situation is that every time someone (1) vertically shifts a line
or (2) or modifies of the Perl array @contrib_excludes,
one has to create a new msvc.diff file.

This fix enhances:

  1. avoids the manual re-creation of the msvc.diff file
     that would occur in Mkvcbuild.pm (and vcregress.pl) after
     (1) a vertical line shift or
     (2) addition or modification of the Perl array @contrib_excludes.
     by
     including a file msvc.diff.R that is a program that
     modifies the Mkvcbuild.pm and vcregress.pl.

  2. adds the ability to compile plr using PostgreSQL
     git branches, git tags, or git commit hashes

  3. adds demo compilations plr using PostgreSQL
     versions(git tags): REL_13_0 and REL_12_0

Issue Fix https://github.com/postgres-plr/plr/issues/89

commit.message:
Issue Fix #92 General documentation updates (#108)

Enhancements:

1.  Corrected the original copyright year to 2003.
2.  Versions are updated to PostgreSQL 13 and R 4.1.0.
3.  Adjusted PostgreSQL keyword capitalization plus syntax enhancements.
4.  Added a paragraph about literal characters in the body of an R function.
5.  Added a paragraph starting with `If R is built and installed using a sub-architecture`.
6.  Added the comprehensive section: Installing from a Pre-Built "plr".
7.  Added another easy to understand `window` example (and some reorganization).
8.  Added documentation on the Inline Handler (I just used the "regression test case").
9.  Added documentation on Stored Procedures  (I just used the "regression test case").
10. Added documentation on Transactions in Stored Procedures
   (I just used the "regression test case").

Issue Fix https://github.com/postgres-plr/plr/issues/92
